text:
Giuseppe (Joe) Padovano
At the age of 93, Giuseppe (Joe) Padovano passed away. Giuseppe was born in 1930 to Maria Cardona and Rocco Padovano in Taurinova, Reggio Calabria, Italy.
Giuseppe experienced heartbreak with the loss of his son, Rocco in 2013. He is survived by: his loving wife of 62 years, Concetta; his son Giuseppe (Pino), his wife, Angelina Di Fonzo and their son, Marcus; his daughter Maria Pesa, her husband, John and their children Alexandra and Sebastian. He is also survived by his grandson, Ryan Macmillan.
Giuseppe was predeceased by other loved ones: parents, Rocco and Maria; parents-in-law, Giuseppe and Teresa Gallo; siblings: Luigi (Concetta), Salvatore (Elvira), Giulia Avignone (Bruno), Carmelo (Rina), Attilio, Carmela Moretto (Vittorio) and Antonio; siblings-in-law: Antonio and Franca Gallo, Carmela and Carmen Sorace, Teresa and Pietro Anania, Alfonso Gallo, Carlo Gallo, Pietro Gallo, Vittorio Mauro
He is survived by siblings-in-law: Maria Napoletano (Luigi), Pina Mauro, Vittoria Colevecchio (Ferdinando), Loretta Gallo, and Linda Gallo along with many nieces and nephews.
Visitation for family and friends will be held at Bell Burnaby Funeral Chapel, 4276 Hastings Street, Burnaby, British Columbia on Wednesday, September 4, 2024 from 6:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m.
A life of hard work and love of family will be celebrated at St. Helen's Parish, 3060 Triumph Street, Burnaby, British Columbia on Thursday, September 5, 2024 at 11:00 a.m. Entombment will follow at Ocean View Burial Park, Burnaby, British Columbia following the service. In lieu of flowers donations in Giuseppe's name can be made to the Heart and Stroke Foundation, PO Box 460 STN K, Toronto, ON, M4P 9Z9, online heartandstroke.ca/donate
Published online August 30, 2024

Plant a tree: How does it work
When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.
An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.
After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.
Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.
Tree Planting Timeline
Orders placed in:
January - May
Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.
June - December
Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
